greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of chi(-x^2) * psi(-x^3)^2 in powers of x where psi(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-2/3) * eta(q^2) * eta(q^3)^2 * eta(q^12)^2 / (eta(q^4) * eta(q^6)^2) in powers of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x^2, x^4] QPochhammer[ x^3]^2 / QPochhammer[ x^6, x^12]^2, {x, 0, n}];
a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, 0, (-1)^Quotient[ n, 2] DivisorSum[ 3 n + 2, KroneckerSymbol[-2, #] &]];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^3 + A)^2 * eta(x^12 + A)^2 / (eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^6 + A)^2), n))};
(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, (-1)^(n\2) * sumdiv(3*n + 2, d, kronecker( -2, d)))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 09 2015
